About
Software Engineer with around 5.5 years of experience in developing web application and SaaS products, for diverse industry clients. 

Highly instrumental in all phases of the SDLC, with expertise in data structures, algorithms and system design.
Technical Skills include Java, Spring Boot, Hibernate, C/C++, REST APIs, Postgres, SQL, PL/SQL, AWS, GCP(Google Cloud Platform), GIT, GitHub, etc.

Recently I was sitting with a friend and we were having a conversation on the topic of humans vs animals. We agreed that we are worse than animals, and you can see it everywhere.
There are problems only for humans created by humans, you can't find it in any other species.

Poverty! Hunger! and the list goes on....
‚Ä¶more
Aravind Unni
Aravind Unni
   ‚Ä¢ 3rd+
Verified ‚Ä¢ 3rd+
Urban Practitioner, Researcher & Development Professional, New Delhi
Urban Practitioner, Researcher & Development Professional, New Delhi
hashtag
#NeighbourhoodWalks

Morning walks offer more than just health and calm‚Äîthey offer clarity. Streets that are chaotic by day reveal their truths in the quiet of early hours.
Walking through my Delhi neighbourhood, I notice things. Some delightful, some frustrating.

In the last few months, I‚Äôve been seeing cars fitted with spike strips‚Äîmeant to keep dogs and cats from climbing or resting on them.

Let that sink in. Cars parked on public roads, occupying most of the pavements, shaded space under trees - now come armed to keep animals away! And this isn‚Äôt new. We‚Äôve seen spikes under flyovers, on benches, at bus stops‚Äîmeant to prevent people, especially the homeless, from sitting or sleeping. So this then is just an adaptation - innovation for the worse.

It says a lot about who we are becoming‚Äîand a lot about our cities too. Places where exclusion is designed, and empathy is pushed out. Our cities, streets need to change. Not for accomodating parked steel boxes guzzling fossil fuels but for trees to give shade, people to sit, for children to walk to school, for dogs to rest and so on.

We need cities‚Äîand streets‚Äîthat are kind.
‚Ä¶more

‚Ä¢Planning & Scheduling
 Worked on enhancements in APIs and error resolution for Planning & Scheduling Module of CRM-MES which includes Coil Linking, Coil De-Linking, Order Progress, Inventory Management, etc.

‚Ä¢Logistics
Created REST APIs and Oracle procedures for Extra to Order(ETO) , Planning Hold, Dispatch Reporting & Daily Production.

‚Ä¢Data Exchange b/w Systems
Implemented data sharing of CRM-MES with Level 2 automation for PLTCM and CAL, Lab Management System, Order Management System for communication between these systems with CRM- MES.

‚Ä¢Quality Assessment(QA)
Developed QA Module of CRM-MES which includes Sample & Test Result Management , Quality Decision, Coil Hold, Lab Report, Batch Defect Management, Quality Summary & Coil Card which handles different functions of QA.

‚Ä¢System Design(Low Level)
Developed the application architecture, master page and common modules for database access, error logging, excel processing, common popups, etc. for IT system to manage operations of CRM of TSK Plant.

‚Ä¢MES Auditing
Developed triggers and procedures for auditing changes of over 25+ tables which processes critical business data of CRM-MES for TSK Plant.

‚Ä¢Reporting System
Designed, developed & deployed of reporting system to digitize and automate the daily reporting system of HSM(Hot Strip Mill) Yard(3MTPA). It was further extended for other reports also.
